  "triples": [
    {"s":"inversion recovery method", "p":"measures", "o":"T1", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"Now, let’s look at how T1 can be measured using the inversion recovery method."},
    {"s":"inversion recovery method", "p":"uses", "o":"180° pulse", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"The idea is to start with a one-hundred-eighty-degree pulse, which flips the net magnetization completely upside down along the negative Z-axis."},
    {"s":"inversion recovery method", "p":"uses", "o":"variable delay tau", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"Once it is inverted, we allow it to recover toward equilibrium during a delay time, which we call tau."},
    {"s":"inversion recovery method", "p":"uses", "o":"90° pulse", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"At the end of the delay, we apply a ninety-degree pulse."},

evidence: At the end of the delay, we apply a ninety-degree pulse.
